result.execSummary:
The defendant Malcolm Lamont Bennett Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence; credit for 296 days time served
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malcolm Lamont Bennett Jr

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 52 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 296 days time served, CONCURRENT WITH any other sentence.  CONFINEMENT of 28 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS.

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel. 

e-FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Malcolm Lamont Bennett in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Malcolm Lamont Bennett in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT  1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Case proceeded to sentencing.

filed.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Malcolm Lamont Bennett not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Jury trial.  Defense request an adjournment. Defendant was not produced for todays hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Case set for final pretrial. Case remains in a jury trial posture. No pending issues remain. Jury trial remains scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 8:15 am, Branch 38.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court via zoom, defendant Malcolm Lamont Bennett not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Final pre-trial.  Defense request an adjournment. State does not object. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Malcolm Lamont Bennett in court, via zoom, with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Malcolm Lamont Bennett in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Arraignment.   Original Information received and e-filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. Any evidentiary matters will be heard on the final pretrial date. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Malcolm Lamont Bennett in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Arraignment scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Malcolm Lamont Bennett in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Malcolm Lamont Bennett in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.

Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Malcolm Lamont Bennett in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Malcolm Lamont Bennett in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Malcolm Lamont Bennett appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
